summary: The European Interoperability Framework (EIF) is a pivotal regulatory instrument designed to enhance cross-border cooperation and data exchange among EU member states. It establishes guidelines for achieving interoperability in public services, ensuring that diverse information technology systems can communicate effectively. The EIF promotes the use of common standards and best practices, facilitating seamless data processing and improving efficiency in public administration. By fostering interoperability, the EIF aims to support the digital transformation of the EU, ultimately enhancing citizen access to services and reinforcing the principles of transparency and accountability in governance.
